text.title: BBC Culture | Film & TV
text.text: BBC Culture | Film & TV Skip to content British Broadcasting Corporation Home News Sport Business Innovation Culture Arts Travel Earth Audio Video Live Film & TV Music Art & Design Style Books Entertainment News Home News Israel-Gaza War War in Ukraine US & Canada UK UK Politics England N. Ireland N. Ireland Politics Scotland Scotland Politics Wales Wales Politics Africa Asia China India Australia Europe Latin America Middle East In Pictures BBC InDepth BBC Verify Sport Business Executive Lounge Technology of Business Future of Business Innovation Technology Science & Health Artificial Intelligence AI v the Mind Culture Film & TV Music Art & Design Style Books Entertainment News Arts Arts in Motion Travel Destinations Africa Antarctica Asia Australia and Pacific Caribbean & Bermuda Central America Europe Middle East North America South America World’s Table Culture & Experiences Adventures The SpeciaList Earth Natural Wonders Weather & Science Climate Solutions Sustainable Business Green Living Audio Podcast Categories Radio Audio FAQs Video BBC Maestro Live Live News Live Sport Home News Sport Business Innovation Culture Arts Travel Earth Audio Video Live Weather Newsletters Film & TV Marty Supreme is 'fresh, funny and exhilarating' ★★★★☆ Timothée Chalamet is "captivating", alongside an "impeccable" Gwyneth Paltrow, in this "madcap" film about a young man who scams and steals his way to becoming a table-tennis champion. See more Latest headlines Euphoria creator teases new storylines for the show's third season Eurovision faces crucial decision over Israel Gavin & Stacey stars reunite for Christmas advert Spotify Wrapped is out: Bad Bunny is world's top artist, who's yours? Fallout stars say post-apocalyptic worlds captivate people The Watch List 12 of the best films to watch this December From the third instalment of the Avatar phenomenon to a Timothée Chalamet-starring awards contender – these are the films to watch at the cinema and stream at home this month. Nine of the best TV shows to watch this December From Netflix's new female-led Western with Lena Headey and Gillian Anderson to the return of post-apocalyptic hit Fallout and the final ever episodes of Stranger Things. More from our Culture editors Oscar-tipped Hamnet is moving but 'manipulative' ★★☆☆☆ The Shakespeare drama starring Paul Mescal and Jessie Buckley has a stellar cast but is "exploitative" and lacks subtlety. Stranger Things' final series is 'thrilling' ★★★★☆ The Netflix sci-fi is back after a three-year wait, with its young stars now in their 20s – and the first four episodes of this final season suggest an "all-time ending" is in store. The film exploring myths about being left-handed Left-handedness is often seen as being "wrong" – and also as a sign of "genius". Left-Handed Girl draws on the prejudice director Shih-Ching Tsou faced growing up in Taiwan. Why Shakespeare's wife and son remain a mystery Oscar-tipped new film Hamnet imagines the home life of William and Agnes Shakespeare – and the "soul-crushing" loss of their child. It's a powerful story that fills in many blanks. The centuries-old origins of the witch's hat As Wicked: For Good is released, what are the historic meanings of conical headwear, and how has it evolved – from its ancient origins to the empowered Elphaba? Wicked sequel is 'more captivating' than original ★★★★☆ The musical adaptation's second and final instalment isn't likely to win any sceptics over – but it's consistently enjoyable, and sees Ariana Grande, in particular, "really shine". Watch When Hugh Jackman did karaoke with Neil Diamond The actor reveals which songs he sang with the music legend when they ended up at his house in Colorado. Film & TV Rosamund Pike hadn't seen a Bond film before her audition The actress reveals that she turned up to her audition in the wrong attire for a Bond girl. Film & TV How Kim Kardashian ended up walking Madonna's dog The reality TV star sparks laughter when she reveals her quirky bracelet payment for a childhood gig. Film & TV What Jennifer Lawrence fed Robert Pattinson for dinner The actress reveals she dug through her rubbish bin when her co-star came over hungry one night. Film & TV Bruce Springsteen watched Jeremy Allen White play him on set The music icon reveals that he feels guilty he was on the set of Springsteen: Deliver Me from Nowhere. Film & TV Three films Aimee Lou Wood says will change your life The actress shares the films she insists everyone should see - and why they can completely shift your outlook. Film & TV Julia Roberts got a little too excited at Wimbledon The actress explains why Benedict Cumberbatch had to calm her down during a match. Film & TV The secret to finding perfect film locations in NYC Discover insider tips from a veteran location manager who reveals how filmmakers choose iconic backdrops. Film & TV Taylor Swift shows off engagement ring The pop star describes the proposal from Travis Kelce that broke the internet. Film & TV Leonardo DiCaprio reveals the films he can't stop watching From Goodfellas to Bicycle Thieves, the actor shares the timeless titles he’s watched across decades. Film & TV When Matthew McConaughey said 'no' to a $14.5m offer The actor talks about his challenging transition from rom-coms to more serious roles. Film & TV Olivia Colman reveals her dinner party trick The actress surprises fellow The Roses cast member Benedict Cumberbatch with her physical stunt. Film & TV Pedro Pascal joins Marvel after lemonade stand ambush The actor explains how his Fantastic Four fate was sealed by a bold kid with citrus and connections. Film & TV Superman's least glamorous moments Actor David Corenswet tells us about the moments on set he would rather forget about. Film & TV Gerard Butler: 'Get me out of this costume!' The Scottish actor talks about filming for How to train your dragon. Film & TV Tom Cruise explains how he managed his epic stunt For his latest Mission: Impossible film, the actor prepared for a daunting stunt by resting on a plane wing. Film & TV Cannes like you've never seen it before Tom Brook gives an insider guide to the film festival and takes us behind the scenes and beyond the red carpet. Film & TV Coogler's Warren Buffet quip cracks up Michael B Jordan Sinners director Ryan Coogler jokes about his 'early investment' in his long-time actor friend. Film & TV Hailee Steinfeld's funniest moments on set Sharing the screen with Michael B Jordan, Woody Harrelson or Rebel Wilson comes lots of laughter. Film & TV 'One to one' with John Lennon and Yoko Ono BBC's Tom Brook explores never-before-seen footage and shares his personal connection with the new documentary. Film & TV More film and TV 1 day ago 'Kevin - sorry, Macaulay': Fallout's Ella Purnell was starstruck on set The actress says meeting the Home Alone star was like seeing 'an old school friend that you grew up with'. 1 day ago 1 day ago Gary Lineker takes football podcast to Netflix The Rest is Football will stream on Netflix during next summer's World Cup as part of a new deal. 1 day ago 2 days ago Full House star Dave Coulier diagnosed with tongue cancer The 66-year-old had previously been diagnosed with non-Hodgkin Lymphoma, a form of blood cancer. 2 days ago 2 days ago Friends to leave Netflix in UK at the end of the year The comedy, which is one of the streamer's most popular shows, will leave the platform on 30 December. 2 days ago 2 days ago Iranian director given jail sentence while on trip to collect US awards Jafar Panahi gets a one-year sentence in his absence for "propaganda activities" against the Iranian system. 2 days ago 2 days ago It was 'crazy' to land a Wicked role, says Esme, 9 The Huddersfield youngster attends a special screening of Wicked: For Good with friends and family. 2 days ago 3 days ago TV architect Hugh Wallace dies, aged 68 Hugh Wallace, 68, was best known for presenting RTÉ's Home of the Year and the BBC's The Great House Revival 3 days ago 3 days ago Paddington's West End musical declared a hit by critics The beloved bear stars in a new stage adaptation with songs written by McFly's Tom Fletcher. 3 days ago 3 days ago Star hails Yorkshire market town where film was shot The Hollywood actor was part of a star-studded cast to descend on Knaresborough for a new movie. 3 days ago ...
